main_definition: Broadway refers to the famous street in New York City, known for its world-class theatre district, or an idiom representing quality performances or renowned entities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A street in Manhattan, New York City, that runs from Times Square south to Union Square. It is home to the largest concentration of commercial theaters in the English-speaking world.
meanings_and_examples.example: The new Broadway musical has received rave reviews for its innovative storytelling and stunning set design.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom that implies a high standard or exceptional quality, often used to describe performances in the theatre industry. It is derived from the prestigious Broadway theatre district in New York City.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their singing was so beautiful that it could only be compared to something you'd find on Broadway.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used to describe successful and popular productions, often specifically related to theatrical performances. It is associated with high-quality, well-executed shows.
meanings_and_examples.example: The play received a Tony Award nomination for its outstanding direction and memorable score.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A metaphorical term used to describe something that stands out or excels in comparison to others. It is often applied to artistic, cultural, or entertainment endeavors.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their film was a cinematic masterpiece, comparable to the best Hollywood productions.
